Meaning: to be placed on, be set on, be piled on
to succeed, inherit, take over, patch
to separate, part, divide, keep apart
to scheme, plan, play a trick
to be a match for, to rival, to equal
to appear uncomfortable, seem to hate
to put in order, arrange, tidy up
after a long process, at the end of
to be accompanied by, be attended by
to give, donate, do, perform, apply
to be harmful to, hinder, interfere with
